title: Ask HN: Online Learning for Dyslexic Kids?
text:
What are the good online learning programs, specifically designed for dyslexic kids?

I am looking for a program where a child (K-5 elementary) could learn on her own, without much of an adult guidance. I found two great online resources to learn math (Matific and Beast Academy - works great), but I could not find any comparable resources to learn English for dyslexic kids.

What are the best resources for dyslexic kids at the elementary school level?

Ask HN: How and when do you choose your specialization?
text:
It's been a while I am thinking about my career path. I don't know how to choose my specialization. Do you explore until a certain age and then start to specialize? Or focus on one specialization from the beginning? How do you choose if you like all of them? How much should I optimize for money in my age? Do you prefer to be a generalist or an specialist?

Just to give you some context, I am 27, working at a FAANG company as a ML engineer since 2020

I am interested in wide variety of subjects:

- Classic backend development (3 years of experience)

- ML engineering (2 years of experience)

- Applied research in deep learning (My master's degree is deep learning for NLP)

- Intersection of systems & deep learning like how to accelerate training, inference, .... (This is a new area I would like to explore)
